meanings.definition: To make (an action or activity) legal or permissible by law.
meanings.sent1: The government decided to legalize the use of seat belts for safety.
meanings.sent2: Many countries have chosen to legalize same-sex marriage.
meanings.sent3: It would be quite amusing if they decided to legalize wearing pajamas to work.
meanings.sent4: Legalizing graffiti would be like giving artists a blank canvas across the city.
meanings.sent5: Imagine a world where they legalize ice cream for breakfast!

meanings.definition: To give legal validity or sanction to.
meanings.sent1: The judge will legalize the contract once all parties have signed.
meanings.sent2: The notary public will legalize the document with their seal.
meanings.sent3: It's funny to think that a stamp can legalize a piece of paper.
meanings.sent4: Her signature will legalize the agreement, making it official.
meanings.sent5: The royal decree will legalize the new law, ensuring its enforcement.
